channel.title: Fix Various Hacks on Minecraft (PLUGIN) (BUKKIT)
channel.description:
http://forums.bukkit.org/threads/sec-nocheat-v0-8-5-detect-and-fight-the-exploitation-of-various-flaws-bugs-in-mc-677.4523/
This has patches for: -X-RAY -Speed Hack -Air Build -Bed Teleport -Moving (moving includes flying, running, clientside teleporting, walking through walls.)
Have fun.

item.title: Fix Various Hacks on Minecraft (PLUGIN) (BUKKIT)

Read full topic

item.title: Fix Various Hacks on Minecraft (PLUGIN) (BUKKIT)
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:21, topic:391087”][quote author=B2300 T4nk link=topic=487037.msg3571222#msg3571222 date=1303065626]

First of all, that, again, assumes a good client. Nothing stops the client from just ignoring the response from the server that says ‘no xray’.

And lastly, like I’m going to download a random binary and run it on my server, ha!
[/quote]You don’t need to be bitchy

Hehe, I wasn’t, I was just explaining why drubrkletern’s plugin is useless.

Cocoa (Zac) provided me with an html document that runs Minecraft through the browser. I’m not sure how it works but it’s possible to use a completely modified client which only can connect through the web-browser, making sure everyone is equal.

Yes, it would be easy (though not legal) for me to make a minecraft applet to play on this server through. But even if the protocol was edited to only allow that client, nothing would stop anyone from editing their Xray client the exact same way.

The end problem is in client-server programming you are NEVER supposed to trust the client, and minecraft in most places trusts the client implicitly. The only way to fix this for good is to completely rewrite both client and server.[/quote]

It’s a good thing Mojang finally realized that mistake and is giving more power to the server as they go along.

Read full topic

item.title: Fix Various Hacks on Minecraft (PLUGIN) (BUKKIT)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“B2300 T4nk, post:18, topic:391087”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=487037.msg3571026#msg3571026 date=1303058516]
First of all, that, again, assumes a good client. Nothing stops the client from just ignoring the response from the server that says ‘no xray’.

And lastly, like I’m going to download a random binary and run it on my server, ha!
[/quote]You don’t need to be bitchy :([/quote]
Hehe, I wasn’t, I was just explaining why drubrkletern’s plugin is useless.

LilXCj:

Cocoa (Zac) provided me with an html document that runs Minecraft through the browser. I’m not sure how it works but it’s possible to use a completely modified client which only can connect through the web-browser, making sure everyone is equal.

Yes, it would be easy (though not legal) for me to make a minecraft applet to play on this server through. But even if the protocol was edited to only allow that client, nothing would stop anyone from editing their Xray client the exact same way.

The end problem is in client-server programming you are NEVER supposed to trust the client, and minecraft in most places trusts the client implicitly. The only way to fix this for good is to completely rewrite both client and server.

Read full topic

item.title: Fix Various Hacks on Minecraft (PLUGIN) (BUKKIT)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

LilXCj:

Cocoa (Zac) provided me with an html document that runs Minecraft through the browser. I’m not sure how it works but it’s possible to use a completely modified client which only can connect through the web-browser, making sure everyone is equal.

Minecraft game jar is an applet itself. The launcher just embeds the applet into itself.

Read full topic

http://www.minecraftforum.net/viewtopic.php?f=1032&t=272846

there is a plugin to stop ppl from using it on the top of the page

item.title: Fix Various Hacks on Minecraft (PLUGIN) (BUKKIT)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:13, topic:391087”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=487037.msg3570416#msg3570416 date=1302993104]
With an xray mod you can get a stack of diamonds in about 20 minutes. 36 in like 2 hours is totally acceptable.
[/quote]

The problem is: What do you determine constant?

It’s a known fact that diamond appears frequently in levels 1-16 and I’ve once pulled out two diamond veins sitting next to each other. Should this mod consider “constant”, I’d be banned because I found too many diamonds in one point of time.[/quote]
Then mine some, come back later and mine more, its as simple as that. As long as nobody is around your cave, you should be fine.

Read full topic

reyx7:

With an xray mod you can get a stack of diamonds in about 20 minutes. 36 in like 2 hours is totally acceptable.

The problem is: What do you determine constant?

It’s a known fact that diamond appears frequently in levels 1-16 and I’ve once pulled out two diamond veins sitting next to each other. Should this mod consider “constant”, I’d be banned because I found too many diamonds in one point of time.

item.title: Fix Various Hacks on Minecraft (PLUGIN) (BUKKIT)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:10, topic:391087”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=487037.msg3570278#msg3570278 date=1302984941]

It doesn’t fix X-Ray, as its not fixable, but it does help you identify them.

Problem X-Ray:

FoundDiamonds: Helps you Identify X-Rayers by telling when a player harvests diamonds. Very configurable.[/quote]

If someone was mining tons of diamond in short periods of time, it would become obvious.

That makes sense.

Hardly. What if someone is using branch mining and comes across a lot of diamonds in a short period of time? Me and Cocoa were on a diamond spree last night collecting 36 diamonds in a few hours.[/quote]
In a few hours, alright. I have done the same in single. Its just the fact, if someone just keeps finding em at a constant rate, easy. It would be come obvious. Its not like nobody will ever have a string of luck -.-

Read full topic

FoundDiamonds: Helps you Identify X-Rayers by telling when a player harvests diamonds. Very configurable.[/quote]

If someone was mining tons of diamond in short periods of time, it would become obvious.

That makes sense.[/quote]

Hardly. What if someone is using branch mining and comes across a lot of diamonds in a short period of time? Me and Cocoa were on a diamond spree last night collecting 36 diamonds in a few hours.
